Youth
Organizations
Resources
Company
- Assisting with photo and video content creation at events and projects;
- Helping with creating clear and engaging captions and text materials for social media posts;
- Supporting the scheduling and publishing of posts on Instagram, Facebook, TikTok and LinkedIn;
- Adapting content to different formats and platforms (feed posts, stories, reels, carousels, TikTok videos);
- Organizing visual assets in OneDrive and other internal platforms;
- Organizing media files in shared drives and preparing materials for colleagues and partners;
- Creating and maintaining simple content calendars in Excel for multiple brands and platforms;
- Joining events to document activities for content purposes;
- Assisting in creating branding materials: roll-ups, posters, textile banners, badges, folders, lanyards, lightboxes and other visual elements used at events;
- Observing how digital campaigns are planned and how pages are maintained;
- Supporting basic photo-video editing and preparing visual assets for internal and client projects;
- Monitoring online trends and adapting content to platform updates;
- Brainstorming original content topics that perform well on social media;
- Assisting with website maintenance and basic WordPress page creation;
- Uploading articles, press releases and updates on company websites;
- Supporting basic community management: replying to messages and comments, reposting content in stories and posting in relevant Facebook groups;
- Helping with basic performance tracking by collecting screenshots, statistics and simple reports for social media and website activity
Monday to Friday

AIESEC is a non-governmental not-for-profit organization in consultative status with the United Nations Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC), affiliated with the UN DPI, member of ICMYO, and is recognized by UNESCO. AIESEC International is registered as a non for profit organization, corporation number 1055154-6 in Montreal, Canada.
